title: Dynamic Pressure Formula
text: Use the relation between dynamic pressure and the square of velocity: $$p=\frac{1}{2} ρ v^2$$ where $$p$$ is the dynamic pressure, ρ is the density of the fluid, and v is the speed of the fluid.

title: Relate the Two Pressure Readings
text: Since the altitude (and thus air density ρ) remains constant, the ratio of the pressures is proportional to the square of the ratio of the speeds: $$\frac{p_2}{p_1}=\left(\frac{v_2}{v_1}\right)^2$$

title: Calculate the Pressure at the New Speed
text: Plug in the values $$v_1=\frac{200km}{h}$$, $$v_2=\frac{700km}{h}$$, $$p_1=15mm$$ Hg, and solve for $$p_2$$ in mm Hg. (round to integer)
